title: Passport maker De La Rue calls on turnaround heavyweight to revive fortunes
text:
Turnaround specialist Clive Vacher will take up the top job at De La Rue today in a bid to recover the fortunes of the embattled banknotes and passport printer.

Mr Vacher, who has “significant experience” in turning around flailing businesses, led the private sale of Lincoln-based semiconductor supplier Dynex Power in March.

He has also held senior positions with Rolls-Royce, American aerospace group General Dynamics and interior cabin product manufacturer B/E Aerospace, and is an alumnus of Columbia, MIT, Stanford and the London School of Economics.

The move follows the ousting of previous De La Rue chief Martin Sutherland over the summer and the appointment of Kevin Loosemore as chairman designate,...
